intro: Landolphia paraensis, commonly known as the Paraensis Crown Vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
